Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Clientele \Cli`en*tele"\ (? or ?), n. [L. clientela: cf. F. client[`e]le.] 1. The condition or position of a client; clientship. [Obs.] --Bp. Hall. [1913 Webster]
2. The clients or dependents of a nobleman of patron. [1913 Webster]
3. The persons who make habitual use of the services of another person; one's clients, collectively; as, the clientele of a lawyer, doctor, notary, etc. [1913 Webster]
clientele n : customers collectively; "they have an upper class clientele" [syn: {patronage}, {business}]
